action.action-desc: Ms. Moore (for herself and Mr. Pocan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act to ensure that recipients of assistance under that Act provide services to sexual and gender minority youth in a manner that is culturally competent, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Runaway and Homeless Youth Inclusion Act of 2013.

subsection.text: Section 312(b) of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5712(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6) by inserting after cultural minority the following: , persons who are in a minority category related to sexual orientation or gender identity or expression,;
in paragraph (7) by inserting after services), the following: including demographics on the sexual orientation and gender identity or expression of the youth it serves,;
in paragraph (12)(C)(ii) by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (13) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
shall serve youth in a manner that is culturally competent.

subsection.text: Section 322(a) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 5714–2(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (15) by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (16) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
to serve youth in a manner that is culturally competent.

subsection.text: Section 351 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 5714–41) is amended by adding at the end the following:

To be eligible to receive grants under subsection (a), an applicant shall certify to the Secretary that the applicant has systems in place to ensure that the applicant provides services to all youth in a culturally competent manner.
Section 302 of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5701) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (5) by striking and at the end;
by redesignating paragraph (6) as paragraph (7); and
by inserting after paragraph (5) the following:

lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender youth comprise an estimated 3 to 5 percent of the youth population of the United States but such youth account for up to 40 percent of the homeless youth population of the United States; and

section.text: Section 311(a)(2)(C) of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5711(a)(2)(C)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iii) by striking and at the end;
in clause (iv) by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: providing resources for families of sexual and gender minority youth who may be struggling with understanding or accepting the sexual orientation or gender identity or expression of the individual.

section.text: Section 345(a) of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5714–25(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1) by striking and at the end; and
by adding at the end the following:
that includes data on the demographics of such individuals, including whether such individuals are sexual and gender minority youth; and
that does not disclose the identity of individual runaway or homeless youth.

section.header: Inclusion of nondiscrimination statement in Runaway and Homeless Youth Act
section.text: Part F of title III of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5714a et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: No person in the United States shall, on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or disability, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be subjected to discrimination under—

paragraph.text: any program or activity funded in whole or in part with funds appropriated for grants, agreements, and other assistance administered with funds made available under this title.

subsection.text: The authority of the Attorney General and the Office of Justice Programs to enforce this section shall be the same as it is under section 809 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3789d).

Nothing in this section may be construed, interpreted, or applied to supplant, displace, preempt, or otherwise diminish the responsibilities and liabilities under other State or Federal civil rights law, whether statutory or common.

section.text: Section 387 of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5732a) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (5) through (8) as paragraphs (9) through (12), respectively;
by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (4) as paragraphs (4) through (6), respectively;
by redesignating paragraph (1) as paragraph (2);
by inserting after In this title: the following:
The term culturally competent means—

subparagraph.text: having a defined set of values and principles and demonstrate behaviors, attitudes, policies, and structures that enable effective working relationships with individuals of diverse backgrounds, including sexual and gender minority youth; and

clause.text: acquire and institutionalize cultural knowledge; and
adapt to diversity and cultural contexts of a community.

paragraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (2) (as redesignated by paragraph (3) of this section) the following:

The term gender identity or expression means an individual’s gender-related identity, appearance, or behavior, whether or not that identity, appearance, or behavior differs from that which is traditionally associated with the individual’s physiology or assigned sex at birth.
by inserting after paragraph (6) (as redesignated by paragraph (2) of this section) the following:
The term sexual and gender minority youth means a runaway or homeless youth covered under this Act who is in a minority category related to sexual orientation or gender identity or expression.
The term sexual orientation means homosexuality, heterosexuality, or bisexuality.
